title: 106_hr2651
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Physician Self-Referral Amendments of 1999" and includes a table of contents. The "Physician Self-Referral Amendments of 1999" includes provisions such as eliminating restrictions on physician referrals based on compensation arrangements, exceptions to ownership referral prohibitions, changes in the definition of group practice, and permitting supervision of clinical laboratory services by independent contractor pathologists. Eliminating restrictions on physician referrals based on compensation arrangements. The text amends the Social Security Act to allow ownership or investment interest in an entity through equity, with conforming amendments to subsections. The text amends the Social Security Act by redesignating paragraphs and amending headings in subsections (b) and (c), and making changes in subsection (d). The text amends the Social Security Act by redesignating paragraphs and amending headings in subsections (b) and (c), and making changes in subsection (d) related to publicly traded securities and mutual funds. The text amends the Social Security Act by redesignating paragraphs and amending headings in subsections (b) and (c), and making changes in subsection (d) related to publicly traded securities and mutual funds. It also involves striking subsection (e) and making adjustments in subsection (f) regarding ownership and investment. The text further amends subsection (h) by removing paragraphs (1), (2), and (3), eliminating clause (iv) in paragraph (4)(A), and revising paragraph (4)(B) by removing certain rules and references. The text amends subsection (h) by removing paragraphs (1), (2), and (3), eliminating clause (iv) in paragraph (4)(A), and revising paragraph (4)(B) by removing certain rules and references, and inserting new rules for faculty. SEC. 3. EXCEPTIONS TO OWNERSHIP REFERRAL PROHIBITIONS. Revisions to Exception for In-Office Ancillary Services include repealing the site-of-service requirement in Section 1877 of the Social Security Act. This allows services to be personally furnished by the referring physician, a physician in the same group practice, or individuals under their supervision. The new paragraph added to Section 1877 of the Social Security Act defines "general supervision" as the legal responsibility of a physician or group practice for services performed by individuals under their supervision, ensuring they meet licensure and certification requirements. The physician or group practice is legally responsible for services performed by individuals under their supervision, ensuring they meet licensure and certification requirements. Section 1877 of the Act is amended to clarify the treatment of physician owners of group practices. The heading is also amended to specify ancillary services furnished personally or through a group practice. Additionally, there is a clarification of the exception for services furnished in a rural area. The amendment to Section 1877 of the Act clarifies the treatment of physician owners of group practices and specifies ancillary services provided personally or through a group practice. There is also a clarification regarding the exception for services rendered in rural areas, with a change from "substantially all" to "not less than 75 percent". The amendment clarifies the definition of group practice and specifies ancillary services provided personally or through a group practice. The Social Security Act is amended to clarify the definition of group practice, stating that a physician is considered a 'member' of a group if they are an owner or employee of the group. SEC. 5. DELAY IN IMPLEMENTATION OF 1993 OWNERSHIP REFERRAL CHANGES UNTIL PROMULGATION OF FINAL REGULATIONS. The amendments from the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 regarding ownership referral changes will not apply to any referrals made before final regulations are issued by the Secretary of Health and Human Services.

SEC. 6. EXCLUSION OF INTRAOCULAR LENSES, EYEGLASSES, AND CONTACT LENSES. SEC. 6. EXCLUSION OF INTRAOCULAR LENSES, EYEGLASSES, AND CONTACT LENSES. Section 1877(h)(6)(H) of the Social Security Act is amended to exclude intraocular lenses, eyeglasses, and contact lenses from coverage. SEC. 7 amends the Social Security Act to allow pathologists supervising clinical laboratory services for a group practice to be considered members of that group practice. SEC. 8 specifies the effective date of the amendment. The amendments made by sections 2 through 4 and 6 and 7 of this Act apply to referrals made on or after the date of the enactment of this Act, regardless of whether or not regulations are promulgated to carry out such amendments.
